subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: Real Madrid won, 1-0, at archrival Barcelona to extend its lead in Spanish soccer’s Primera Liga to 7 points.Madrid midfielder Julio Baptista’s 36th-minute goal separated the teams in front of a crowd of 98,000 at the Camp Nou, where Barcelona had won its previous 11 matches this season.“We are playing in a style that allows us to win matches,” Real Madrid Coach Bernd Schuster said in comments posted on his team’s Web site. “We are in a great position right now, but titles are won at the end of the campaign.”Defending champion Madrid enters the midseason break with 41 points from 17 matches. Barcelona has 34 points, with Espanyol a point further back. Villarreal has 32 points and Atletico Madrid 31 points. Espanyol won, 2-1, at Atletico, and Villarreal was held to a 1-1 home draw by Recreativo Huelva.
